Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to section 76 of the Pooled Registered Pension Plans Acta, makes the annexed Pooled Registered Pension Plans Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Pooled Registered Pension Plans Act.
child, in relation to a person, means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual of whom the person is the legal parent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who is wholly dependent on the person for support and of whom the person has, or immediately before the individual attained the age of 19 years had, in law or in fact, the custody and control;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a child of the person’s spouse or common-law partner; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a spouse or common-law partner of a child of the person.

Definition.Text: costs means all fees, levies and other charges that reduce a member’s return on investment other than those that are triggered by the member’s actions.
debt obligation means a bond, debenture, note or other evidence of indebtedness of an entity.
deferred life annuity has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Pension Benefits Standards Regulations, 1985.
entity means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation, trust, partnership or fund or an unincorporated association or organization; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Her Majesty in right of Canada or of a province or the government of a foreign country or of a political subdivision of a foreign country, or an agency of any of them.

Definition.Text: immediate life annuity has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Pension Benefits Standards Regulations, 1985.
life income fund means a registered retirement income fund that meets the conditions set out in section 41.

loan includes a deposit, financial lease, conditional sales contract, repurchase agreement and any other similar arrangement for obtaining money or credit, but does not include investments in securities or the making of an acceptance, endorsement or other guarantee mechanism.
locked-in RRSP means a registered retirement savings plan that meets the conditions set out in section 38.
marketplace means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an exchange;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a quotation and trade-reporting system;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other entity not included in paragraph (a) or (b) that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: constitutes, maintains or provides a market or facility for bringing together buyers and sellers of securities or derivatives,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: brings together the orders for securities or derivatives of multiple buyers and sellers, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: uses established, non-discretionary methods under which the orders interact and with which the buyers and sellers entering the orders agree to the terms of a trade.

Definition.Text: market value, in respect of an asset, means the price that would be obtained for the purchase or sale of the asset in an open market under conditions requisite to a fair transaction between parties who are at arm’s length and acting prudently, knowledgeably and willingly.
person includes an entity.
PRPP means a pooled registered pension plan.

MarginalNote.DefinedTermFr: fonds enregistré de revenu de retraite

Definition.Text: registered retirement income fund has the same meaning as in subsection 146.3(1) of the Income Tax Act.
registered retirement savings plan has the same meaning as in subsection 146(1) of the Income Tax Act.

related party, in respect of a PRPP, means a person — other than Her Majesty in right of Canada or of a province, or an agency of either one of them, or a bank, trust company or other financial institution that holds the assets of the PRPP but that is not the administrator of the PRPP — who is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an officer, an employee or a member of the board of directors of the administrator of the PRPP;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: responsible for holding or investing the assets of the PRPP, or an officer, director or employee of the person who is responsible for holding or investing those assets;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the PRPP;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the spouse or common-law partner or a child of any person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (c);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that is directly or indirectly controlled by a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an entity in which a person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), or the spouse or common-law partner or a child of such a person, has a substantial investment; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an entity that has a substantial investment in the administrator of the PRPP.

Definition.Text: restricted life income fund means a registered retirement income fund that meets the conditions set out in section 40.
restricted locked-in savings plan means a registered retirement savings plan that meets the conditions set out in section 39.
security means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a corporation, a share of any class of shares of the corporation or a debt obligation of the corporation, and includes a warrant of the corporation, but does not include a deposit with a financial institution or a document evidencing such a deposit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any other entity, any ownership interest in or debt obligation of the entity.

Definition.Text: voting share means a share of any class of shares of a corporation that carries voting rights under all circumstances or by reason of an event that has occurred and is continuing or by reason of a condition that has been fulfilled.

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the making, holding or acquiring of an investment indirectly by an administrator on behalf of a PRPP, the holding, acquiring or owning of property indirectly by an administrator on behalf of a PRPP or the lending of money indirectly by an administrator on behalf of a PRPP includes the making, holding, acquiring, owning or lending of an investment, a property or money, as the case may be, by a mutual fund, a pooled fund, a segregated fund or a trust fund in which the funds of a member’s account have been invested.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person or an administrator of a PRPP controls a corporation if securities of the corporation to which are attached more than 50% of the votes that may be cast to elect the directors of the corporation are beneficially owned by the person or the administrator and the votes attached to those securities are sufficient, if exercised, to elect a majority of the directors of the corporation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person or an administrator of a PRPP controls an unincorporated entity, other than a limited partnership, if more than 50% of the ownership interests into which the unincorporated entity is divided are beneficially owned by the person or the administrator and the person or the administrator is able to direct the business and affairs of the unincorporated entity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the general partner of a limited partnership controls the limited partnership; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a trustee of a trust controls the trust.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a person or an administrator of a PRPP who controls an entity controls any other entity that is controlled by the entity.

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, an entity is affiliated with another entity if the entity is controlled by the other entity or if both entities are controlled by the same person.
For the purposes of these Regulations, a person or an administrator of a PRPP has a substantial investment in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an unincorporated entity if the person or the administrator, or an entity controlled by the person or the administrator, beneficially owns more than 25% of the ownership interests in the unincorporated entity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the voting rights attached to voting shares of the corporation that are beneficially owned by the person or the administrator, or by an entity controlled by the person or the administrator, exceed 10% of the voting rights attached to all of the outstanding voting shares of the corporation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the shares of the corporation that are beneficially owned by the person or the administrator, or by an entity controlled by the person or the administrator, represent ownership of more than 25% of the shareholders’ equity of the corporation.

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a person or an administrator of a PRPP is associated with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that the person or the administrator controls and every affiliate of every such corporation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who controls the person or the administrator;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a partner who has a substantial investment in a partnership in which the person or the administrator has a substantial investment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a trust or estate or succession in which the person or the administrator has a substantial investment or for which the person or the administrator serves as a trustee or in a similar capacity to a trustee;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the spouse or common-law partner of the person; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a brother, sister or child or other descendant of the person, or the spouse or common-law partner of any of them.

Heading.TitleText: Designated Provinces and Prescribed Supervisory Authorities

Section.Text: The following provinces are designated provinces for the purposes of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Ontario;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: Quebec;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Nova Scotia;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: Manitoba;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: British Columbia;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: Saskatchewan.

Section.Text: The following supervisory authorities are prescribed for the purposes of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for Ontario, the Superintendent of Financial Services appointed under section 5 of the Financial Services Commission of Ontario Act, 1997, S.O. 1997, c. 28;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: for Quebec, the Autorité des marchés financiers established under section 1 of An Act respecting the Autorité des marchés financiers, CQLR, c. A-33.2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for Nova Scotia, the Superintendent of Pooled Registered Pension Plans appointed under section 6 of the Pooled Registered Pension Plans Act, S.N.S. 2014, c. 37;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for Manitoba, the Superintendent of Pensions employed under subsection 7(1) of The Pension Benefits Act, C.C.S.M. c. P32;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: for British Columbia, the Superintendent of Pensions appointed under section 4 of the Pension Benefits Standards Act, S.B.C. 2012, c. 30; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for Saskatchewan, the Superintendent of Pooled Registered Pension Plans appointed under section 5 of the Pooled Registered Pension Plans (Saskatchewan) Act, S.S. 2013, c. P-16.101.

Section.Text: Sections 5, 7, 14 and 16 and subsections 20(3) and (4) of the Multilateral Agreement Respecting Pooled Registered Pension Plans and Voluntary Retirement Savings Plans are exempt from the application of subsection 7(1) of the Act.
For the purposes of subsection 11(1) of the Act, the Superintendent may, on application, issue a licence authorizing a corporation to be an administrator if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the corporation submits to the Superintendent a five-year business plan that includes

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the reasons why the corporation believes that the PRPPs that it intends to administer will be sustainable over the course of the business plan,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of plans that the corporation intends to have registered as PRPPs,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of how the corporation intends to meet the requirement to provide the PRPPs to its members at low cost, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an estimate of the costs and of the fees, levies and other charges that would be triggered by the actions of a member;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the corporation has the financial resources required for the administration of a PRPP;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the corporation has procedures in place that are sufficient to identify, manage and control the risks associated with the PRPPs;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the corporation has the operational capability to administer a PRPP;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the officers and directors of the corporation are of good character, having demonstrated honesty, integrity and ethical behaviour in all of their professional activities; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the corporation provides, on the request of the Superintendent, any document or information required to assess whether the corporation meets the conditions set out in paragraphs (b) to (e).

Subsection.Text: Every PRPP must provide that the funds in a member’s account are to be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: invested in accordance with sections 9 to 14; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: invested

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in a name that clearly indicates that the investment is held in trust for the PRPP and, if the investment is capable of being registered, registered in that name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the name of a financial institution, or a nominee of it, in accordance with a custodial agreement or trust agreement that is entered into on behalf of the PRPP with the financial institution and that clearly indicates that the investment is held for the PRPP, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the name of CDS Clearing and Depository Services Inc., or a nominee of it, in accordance with a custodial agreement or trust agreement that is entered into on behalf of the PRPP with a financial institution and that clearly indicates that the investment is held for the PRPP.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), a custodial agreement must provide that an investment made or held on behalf of a PRPP under the agreement does not constitute an asset of the custodian or nominee.

The administrator of a PRPP must not, directly or indirectly, invest more than 10% of the total market value of the funds in a member’s account in, or lend more than 10% of the total market value of the funds in a member’s account to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any one person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: associated persons; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: affiliated corporations.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of the funds in a member’s account that are held by a bank, trust company or other financial institution to the extent that the funds are fully insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, by Assuris or by any similar provincial body established for the purpose of providing insurance against loss of deposits with trust companies or other financial institutions.
Subsection (1) does not apply to investments

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a mutual fund, a pooled fund or a segregated fund that meets the requirements applicable to a PRPP that are set out in section 10;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in an unallocated general fund of a person that is authorized to carry on a life insurance business in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that are made in accordance with sections 12 to 14 of Schedule III to the Pension Benefits Standards Regulations, 1985;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in securities issued or fully guaranteed by the Government of Canada, the government of a province, or an agency of either one of them;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in a fund composed of mortgage-backed securities that are fully guaranteed by the Government of Canada, the government of a province, or an agency of either one of them;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in a fund that replicates the composition of a widely recognized index of a broad class of securities that are traded at a marketplace; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: that involve the purchase of a contract or agreement in respect of which the return is based on the performance of a widely recognized index of a broad class of securities traded at a marketplace.

Subsection.Text: The administrator of a PRPP must not, directly or indirectly, invest the assets of the PRPP in the securities of a corporation to which are attached more than 30% of the votes that may be cast to elect the directors of the corporation.
Subsection (1) does not apply to investments that are made in accordance with sections 12 to 14 of Schedule III to the Pension Benefits Standards Regulations, 1985.
For the purposes of sections 11 to 13, “transaction” includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the making of an investment in securities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the taking of an assignment of, or otherwise acquiring, a loan made by a third party;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the taking of a security interest in securities or a hypothec on securities; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any modification, renewal or extension of a prior transaction.

ContinuedParagraph.Text: It does not include the making of a variable payment, the transfer of funds into a member’s account or the withdrawal of funds from a member’s account.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 12 and 13,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if a transaction is entered into by, or on behalf of, a PRPP with a person who the administrator of the PRPP, or any person acting on the administrator’s behalf, knows will become a related party to the PRPP, the person is considered to be a related party of the PRPP in respect of the transaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the fulfilment of an obligation under the terms of any transaction, including the payment of interest on a loan or deposit, is part of the transaction and not a separate transaction.

Subsection.Text: Subject to sections 13 and 14, the administrator of a PRPP must not, directly or indirectly,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: lend funds in a member’s account to a related party or invest those funds in the securities of a related party; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enter into a transaction with a related party on behalf of the PRPP.

Subsection.Text: Subject to sections 13 and 14, during the period of 12 months after the day on which a person ceases to be a related party of a PRPP, the administrator of the PRPP must not, directly or indirectly,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: lend funds in a member’s account to that person or invest those funds in the securities of that person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enter into a transaction with that person on behalf of the PRPP.

Section.MarginalNote: Exception — services of a related party

Subsection.Text: The administrator of a PRPP may engage the services of any related party for the operation or administration of the PRPP under terms and conditions that are not less favourable than those, including those relating to price, rent or interest rate, that would apply to a similar transaction in an open market under conditions requisite to a fair transaction between parties who are at arm’s length and acting prudently, knowledgeably and willingly.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — securities of a related party
Subsection.Text: The administrator of a PRPP may invest in the securities of a related party that are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: held by a mutual fund, a pooled fund or a segregated fund

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that meets the requirements applicable to a PRPP that are set out in section 10, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in which investors other than the administrator and its affiliates may invest and are invested;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held by a fund that replicates the composition of a widely recognized index of a broad class of securities traded at a marketplace; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: issued or fully guaranteed by the Government of Canada, the government of a province or an agency of either one of them.

Section.Text: Sections 9 to 13 do not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: investments in a corporation that are held by, or on behalf of, a PRPP as a result of an arrangement, within the meaning of subsection 192(1) of the Canada Business Corporations Act, for the reorganization or liquidation of the corporation or for the amalgamation of the corporation with another corporation, if the investments are to be exchanged for shares or debt obligations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: assets that are acquired by, or on behalf of, a PRPP through the realization of a security interest or a hypothec held by, or on behalf of, the PRPP and that are held for a period not exceeding two years after the day on which the assets were acquired.

Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 23(3) of the Act, if a member does not make an investment choice referred to in subsection 23(1) of the Act within 60 days after the day on which the notice referred to in paragraph 41(2)(a) of the Act is received, the investment option chosen by the administrator as the default option will apply to the member’s account.

Subsection.Text: An administrator of a PRPP must offer the same default option for all of the PRPPs that it administers.
The default option must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a balanced fund; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a portfolio of investments that takes into account a member’s age.

Section.Text: The administrator of a PRPP must provide

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no more than six investment options including the default option in the PRPP; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the same investment options to all members of the PRPP.

Subsection.Text: The administrator of a PRPP must notify a member in writing as soon as feasible after the administrator becomes aware that the member’s investment option will no longer be available.

If the member does not choose another investment option within 60 days after the day on which the notice is received, the administrator must invest the member’s funds in an option that is similar to the previous option or in the default option.
There must be no fee, charge or other levy associated with the transfer of the funds in a member’s account into a new investment option under this section.
The notice must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each investment option that is still available, include the description required under paragraph 23(c);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: indicate that the member has 60 days after the day on which the notice is received to choose another option; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: indicate the administrator’s obligations under subsection (2) if the member does not choose another option within that period.

Section.Text: An administrator may give, offer or agree to give or offer to an employer and an employer may demand, accept or offer or agree to accept from an administrator, as an inducement to enter into a contract with the administrator in respect of a PRPP

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a product or a service on more favourable terms or conditions than the administrator would otherwise offer if the inducement is for the equal benefit of the employees of that employer who are eligible to be members of the PRPP; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to a transfer of assets into the PRPP administered by the administrator, an amount no greater than the employer’s costs associated with the transfer of assets into that PRPP.

Section.Text: The following criteria must be used to determine whether a PRPP is being provided to its members at low cost:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: costs are to be at or below those incurred by members of defined contribution plans that provide investment options to groups of 500 or more members; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: costs are to be the same for all members of a PRPP.

Subsection.Text: A member may set a contribution rate of 0% if 12 months have elapsed since the member’s contributions to the PRPP began.
The rate may be set at 0% for a period of 3 to 60 months. There is no limit on the number of times that the rate may be set at 0%.
The notice to be provided to the administrator under subsection 45(2) of the Act must be in writing and include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the member’s name and contact information and the name of the member’s employer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the period for which the contribution rate is to be set at 0%.

Subsection.Text: The administrator must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no more than 60 days after the day on which the administrator is notified under subsection 45(2) of the Act

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: provide the member with written confirmation of when the contribution rate will be set at 0% and when contributions will resume, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that the member’s contribution rate is set at 0%; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no fewer than 90 days before the day on which contributions are to resume, provide the member with written notice of the day of resumption and the contribution rate on resumption.

Section.Text: The notice required under subsection 41(1) of the Act must include the expected effective date of the contract and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: inform the employees that once the employer enters into the contract with the administrator the employees will be automatically enrolled and become members of the PRPP;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: inform the employees of the notice requirement under subsection 41(2) of the Act and who will send the notice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: inform the employees of a member’s right to terminate their membership in the PRPP by notifying the employer within 60 days after the day on which the notice that is referred to in subsection 41(2) of the Act is received; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: inform the employees of the existence of any deposit accounts, loans, letters of credit or insurance policies that are held by the employer with the administrator.

Section.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 41(2)(b) of the Act, the notice must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: inform the employee of the notice requirements set out in section 29 and include a form that would meet those requirements if completed by the employee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: indicate that, if an administrator offers investment options and a member has not communicated an investment choice within 60 days after receiving the notice, the default option will apply;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: include a description of each investment option that indicates

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its investment objective,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of investments and the degree of risk associated with it,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its top ten holdings by market value,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its performance history,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: that its past performance is not necessarily an indication of its future performance,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and a description of the benchmark that best reflects the composition of the investment option,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the cost associated with the investment option, expressed as a percentage or a fixed amount, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: its target asset allocation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: indicate the contribution rates offered to members;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: indicate the default contribution rate if a member does not make a choice;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: indicate the employer’s contribution rate;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: indicate the date when contributions will begin to be deducted;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: explain the members’ right to set their contribution rate to zero;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: explain how the contributions may be adjusted;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: include a list of any fees, levies and other charges that would be triggered by a member’s actions;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: list any other costs, expressed as a percentage or a fixed amount;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: explain the locking-in provisions of the PRPP;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: provide the address of the Financial Consumer Agency of Canada’s web page pertaining to the cost of PRPPs;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: explain an employee’s right to opt back into the PRPP; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: explain how to obtain more information about the PRPP.

Section.Text: A PRPP must provide that the explanation referred to in subparagraph 57(1)(a)(i) of the Act shall be provided on a website and, on request, directly to the member.
For the purposes of subparagraph 57(1)(a)(ii) of the Act, a PRPP must provide

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that each member and each employer shall be given on a website and, on request, directly to the member, a description of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: each investment option in accordance with paragraph 23(c),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the transfer options available to the member and the costs associated with those options, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any fees, levies and other charges that would be triggered by the member’s actions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that each member shall, if the PRPP provides for variable payments, be given a statement no more than 18 months before and no fewer than 6 months before the day on which the member reaches 55 years of age, that indicates

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the member’s right to elect to receive variable payments starting at 55 years of age, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: how more information in relation to variable payments may be obtained; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that each member will be given, on request, the details of any transactions that have occurred in the member’s account, including any fees, levies and other charges incurred.

Section.Text: For the purposes of subparagraph 57(1)(b) of the Act, the written statement must show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the member’s investment option;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the year, the opening balance, any contributions, the change in the investments’ value — net of costs — and the closing balance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a member who elects to receive variable payments,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of birth used to determine the minimum variable payment,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date the variable payment began to be paid,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the minimum and maximum allowable variable payments as well as the variable payment that the member is to receive,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the investment options from which the variable payments were made and in what proportion they were made from each option,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the payment frequency over the year,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of how the member may change their election regarding the amount to be paid during the year and from which investment option the amount is to be paid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: transferred to another life income fund or to a restricted life income fund,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: transferred to a locked-in RRSP, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: used to purchase an immediate life annuity or a deferred life annuity;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: provides that, on the death of the holder of the life income fund, the funds shall be paid to the holder’s survivor by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: transferring the funds to another life income fund or to a restricted life income fund,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: transferring the funds to a locked-in RRSP, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: using the funds to purchase an immediate life annuity or a deferred life annuity;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: provides that, subject to subsection 53(3) of the Act, the funds or any interest or right in those funds, shall not be transferred, charged, attached, anticipated or given as security and that any transaction appearing to do so is void or, in Quebec, null;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: provides that, in the calendar year in which the holder of the life income fund reaches 55 years of age or in any subsequent calendar year, the funds may be paid to the holder in a lump sum if the holder

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: certifies that the total value of all assets in all locked-in RRSPs, life income funds, restricted locked-in savings plans and restricted life income funds that were created as a result of the transfer, a transfer under the Pension Benefits Standards Act, 1985 or a transfer from another PRPP is not more than 50% of the Year’s Maximum Pensionable Earnings, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: obtains the consent of their spouse or common law partner, if any, and completes and gives a copy of Form 2 and Form 3 of the schedule to the financial institution with whom the contract or arrangement for the life income fund was entered into;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: provides that the holder of the life income fund may withdraw an amount from that fund up to the lesser of the amount determined by the formula set out in subsection 38(2) and 50% of the Year’s Maximum Pensionable Earnings minus any amount withdrawn in the calendar year under this paragraph or under paragraph 38(1)(e), 39(1)(f) or 40(1)(k)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the holder certifies that they have not made a withdrawal in the calendar year under this paragraph or paragraph 38(1)(e), 39(1)(f) or 40(1)(k) other than within the last 30 days before the day on which the certification is made,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in the event that the value determined for M in subsection 38(2) is greater than zero,

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: the holder certifies that they expect to make expenditures on a medical or disability-related treatment or adaptive technology during the calendar year in excess of 20% of the holder’s expected income for that calendar year determined in accordance with the Income Tax Act, other than any amount withdrawn in the calendar year under this paragraph or paragraph 38(1)(e), 39(1)(f) or 40(1)(k), and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: a physician certifies that the medical or disability-related treatment or adaptive technology is required, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the holder’s expected income for the calendar year determined in accordance with the Income Tax Act –– other than any amount withdrawn under this paragraph or paragraph 38(1)(e), 39(1)(f) or 40(1)(k) within the last 30 days before the day on which the certification is made — is less than 75% of the Year’s Maximum Pensionable Earnings, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the holder obtains the consent of their spouse or common law partner, if any, and completes and gives a copy of Form 1 and Form 2 of the schedule to the financial institution with whom the contract or arrangement for the life income fund was entered into; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: provides that the holder of the life income fund who has ceased to be a resident of Canada for at least two years may withdraw any amount from that fund.

Subsection.Text: The life income fund shall provide that the funds may be paid to the holder in a lump sum if a physician certifies that, owing to mental or physical disability, the holder’s life expectancy is likely to be considerably shortened.
For the purposes of paragraphs 50(1)(c) and (3)(c), 53(4)(c) and 54(2)(c) of the Act, the funds in a member’s account may be used to purchase

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an immediate life annuity that provides that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection 53(3) of the Act, no benefit provided under the annuity shall be transferred, charged, attached, anticipated or given as security and that any transaction appearing to do so is void or, in Quebec, null, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: except in the case of the unexpired period of a guaranteed annuity when the annuitant is deceased, no benefit provided under the annuity shall be surrendered during the lifetime of their spouse or common-law partner and that any transaction appearing to do so is void or, in Quebec, null; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a deferred life annuity that provides

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the conditions set out in subparagraphs (a)(i) and (ii),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that if the annuitant dies prior to the day on which the annuity payments begin, the survivor is entitled, on the death of the annuitant, to an amount equal to the commuted value of the deferred life annuity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: that any amount to which the survivor is entitled shall be

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: transferred to a pension plan if the pension plan permits such a transfer and administers the benefit attributed to the transferred funds as if the benefit were that of a plan member,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: used to purchase an immediate life annuity or a deferred life annuity, or

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: transferred to a life income fund or to a restricted life income fund.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Commuted value of deferred life annuity
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the commuted value of the deferred life annuity is to be determined in accordance with section 3500 (“Pension Commuted Values”) of the Standards of Practice of the Actuarial Standards Board, published by the Canadian Institute of Actuaries, as amended from time to time.
For the purposes of paragraph 64(1)(a) of the Act, the addressee must consent in writing, in paper or electronic form, or orally.
Before an addressee consents, the administrator must notify the addressee

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: of the addressee’s right to revoke their consent at any time;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of the addressee’s responsibility to inform the administrator of any changes the addressee makes to the designated information system including any changes made to the contact information for the designated information system; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: of the date when the consent takes effect.

Subsection.Text: Any revocation of consent must be done in writing, in paper or electronic form, or orally.

Section.Text: If an electronic document is provided on a generally accessible information system, such as a website, the administrator must provide to the member written notice, in paper or electronic form, of the electronic document’s availability and location.
An electronic document is considered to have been provided to an addressee when it is entered into or made available on the information system designated by the addressee.

Subsection.Text: If an administrator has reason to believe that an addressee has not received an electronic document or the notice required under section 44, the administrator must mail a paper copy of the document to the addressee.
The mailing of a paper copy does not affect when the electronic document is considered to have been provided under section 45.

Section.Text: An administrator must sign and send two copies of the notice of objection referred to in subsection 37(1) of the Act by registered mail.
A notice of appeal referred to in subsection 38(2) of the Act must be in the form referred to in section 337 of the Federal Courts Rules.

For the purposes of subsection 62(9) of the Act, the termination report is to be prepared by an actuary who is a Fellow of the Canadian Institute of Actuaries, a person authorized to act as an accountant under the laws of a province or other professional advisor.
[Repeal]

These Regulations come into force on the day on which the Pooled Registered Pensions Plans Act, chapter 16 of the Statutes of Canada, 2012, comes into force but if they are registered after that day, they come into force on the day on which they are registered.
